title: Watch Niko Price knock out James Vick with brutal upkick at UFC on ESPN+ 19
text:
Gallery Niko Price def. James Vick at UFC on ESPN+ 19: Best photos view 12 images

Known for his creative violence, Niko Price did not disappoint Saturday night.

At UFC on ESPN+ 19, Price (13-3 MMA, 5-3 UFC) crumpled opponent James Vick (13-4 MMA, 9-4 UFC) with a brutal upkick knockout in the first round of their welterweight contest.

UFC on ESPN+ 19 took place Saturday at Amalie Arena in Tampa, Fla. The card streamed on ESPN+.

After absorbing some hard shots from “The Texecutioner ” on the canvas, the home crowd favorite Price improvised and sent his foot toward the chin of Vick. A bone-chilling thud sounded as his foot hit Vick flush on the face.

Vick’s bloody, unconscious body crumpled onto Price, who landed a few short shots to his already out opponent. Referee Herb Dean stepped in and waived off the contest 1:44 into the opening frame.

Check out Niko Price’s brutal knockout of James Vick in the video below:

The victory was a rebound for Price, who was defeated in his previous fight in July against Geoff Neal.

Between his four UFC performance bonuses, his crazy hammerfist-from-guard knockout of Randy Brown, to his ridiculous come-from-behind knockout of Tim Means, “The Hybrid” has become appointment viewing.

The Blue Corner is MMA Junkie’s blog space. We don’t take it overly serious, and neither should you. If you come complaining to us that something you read here is not hard-hitting news, expect to have the previous sentence repeated in ALL CAPS.
description: Known for his creative violence, Niko Price did not disappoint on Saturday night at UFC on ESPN+ 19.
